summary: Highly motivated planner/scheduler with Navy maintenance and aviation experience. Strong communicator, problem solver, attention to detail, and time management. Certified Nurse Assistant; Lean Six Sigma Green Belt; CPR certified; proficient in Microsoft Office. Pursuing a transition into the health field.

experience.title: Planner/Scheduler
experience.description: Determine schedules, sequences, and assignments for work activities; monitor employees' work levels and performance; monitor tool and part inventories and the condition and maintenance of shops to ensure adequate working conditions; investigate accidents or injuries and prepare reports; compile operational or personnel records; develop, implement, or evaluate maintenance policies and procedures; conduct training; inspect and monitor work areas, examine tools and equipment, and provide employee safety training; requisition materials and supplies; participate in budget preparation and administration; meet with vendors to discuss products used in repair work; compute estimates and actual costs; coordinate with management, engineering, quality control, customer, or union representatives; develop or implement electronic maintenance programs.

experience.title: Maintenance Head Operator
experience.description: Use tools ranging from common hand and power tools to precision measuring instruments; perform routine preventive maintenance; inspect, diagnose, repair machinery; diagnose mechanical problems and determine corrective actions; inspect drives, motors, belts, and replace components; record maintenance actions and costs; train and manage maintenance personnel and subcontractors; develop and evaluate maintenance policies; inspect and monitor work areas for safety; requisition materials and supplies; plan and establish work schedules and production sequences.

experience.title: Aviation Machinist Mechanic
experience.description: Implement airfield safety procedures; monitor aircraft arrivals, parking, refueling, loading, and departures; read and interpret maintenance manuals and service bulletins; inspect and certify maintenance; examine aircraft components; replace or repair worn parts; measure parts with precision instruments; test engine and systems; obtain and check fuel/oil samples; reassemble and reinstall engines; coordinate with supervisors and other workers; plan and establish work schedules; train operations staff; maintain production and cost records.
